column2: What are defense mechanisms in the immune system?
column3: They involve only mechanical actions like coughing and sneezing without chemical support.
column4: They are physical, mechanical, and chemical barriers the body uses to protect against pathogens.

column2: Which system of the body is responsible for defense mechanisms against pathogens?
column3: The nervous system controls all defenses against pathogens.
column4: The immune system protects the body by recognizing and fighting off pathogens.
